author: leotsarev
body:
# Steps to reproduce
Go to https://www.microsoft.com/store/apps/9MZ1SNWT0N5D URL marketed both in docs https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/install/installing-powershell-core-on-windows?view=powershell-7.1 and blogpost here https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/announcing-powershell-7-1/

## Expected behavior
Store page for powershell

## Actual behavior

We are sorry, the page you requested cannot be found.

The URL may be misspelled or the page you're looking for is no longer available.

Also, I can't found Powershell in store using search

comments.author: fMichaleczek
comments.body: @leotsarev You can close your issue, the page is now available.

comments.author: musm
comments.body: Is the Windows Store version the recommended installation route for Windows users over the msi/zip's provided in the release page? Perhaps it would be a good idea to make some comment in the README to this point.

comments.author: user8446
comments.body: I just installed from the Microsoft Store and found a few bugs: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/14059

comments.author: fMichaleczek
comments.body:
@user8446 @musm You understand that Store means sandboxed or at least packaged in a old school metro app in a special folder ? Windows Store has evolved but I'm not sure you can do everything you want. Also remember how store apps update in background. If you are an admin, you dont want. It's for casual usage ! 

The scenario, I have in mind is to use the automatic updated couple of VSCode/PowerShell/PowerShell-VSCode to develop and keep the MSI version to be my default shell

Open a new issue, if you have a scenario that doesn't fit.

This one should be closed as the URL is now online.

title: Can't install from Store
